rename.to: Implement DirRec strategy for regression forecasting

issue.title: Implementation of DirRec strategy for reducing forecasting to (time series) regression

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
<!--
Thanks for contributing a pull request! Please ensure you have taken a look at
the extension guidelines: https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

#### Reference Issues/PRs
Work on #226 
<!--
Example: Fixes #1234. See also #3456.

Please use keywords (e.g., Fixes) to create link to the issues or pull requests
you resolved, so that they will automatically be closed when your pull request
is merged. See https://github.com/blog/1506-closing-issues-via-pull-requests
-->


#### What does this implement/fix? Explain your changes.
<!--
A clear and concise description of what you have implemented. 
-->
Will implement the DirRec strategy for regression forecasting, taking motivation from [Bontempi G., Ben Taieb S., Le Borgne YA. (2013) Machine Learning Strategies for Time Series Forecasting](https://www.researchgate.net/publication/236941795_Machine_Learning_Strategies_for_Time_Series_Forecasting)
#### Does your contribution introduce a new dependency? If yes, which one? 

<!--
If your contribution does add a new dependency, we may suggest to initially develop your contribution in a separate
 companion package in https://github.com/sktime/ to keep external dependencies of the core sktime package to a minimum. 
-->


#### PR checklist for new estimators 
<!--
This is only relevant if you contribute new algorithm or estimator (classifiers, regressors, forecasters, etc
.). If so, please go through the checklist below. Otherwise please delete check list.
-->

- [ ] I have added unit tests and made sure they pass locally.
- [ ] I have updated the existing example notebooks or provided a new one to showcase how my algorithm works.
- [ ] I have updated sktime's [estimator overview](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/master/ESTIMATOR_OVERVIEW.md) and I'm committed to maintain my contribution and provide bug fixes if necessary.

#### Any other comments?
<!--
Please be aware that we are a loose team of volunteers so patience is
necessary; assistance handling other issues is very welcome. We value
all user contributions, no matter how minor they are. If we are slow to
review, either the pull request needs some benchmarking, tinkering,
convincing, etc. or more likely the reviewers are simply busy. In either
case, we ask for your understanding during the review process.

Thanks for contributing!
-->

issue.title: Forecasting wish list

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
For the API design proposal, see [this wiki entry](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/wiki/Forecasting-API-proposal).

## Forecasters
### Atomic 
- [x] NaiveForecaster (strategies={"last",  "mean", "seasonal_last"}) #227 
- [x] PolynomialTrendForecaster (linear, polynomial, locally linear, smoothing splines), see this [chapter](https://otexts.com/fpp2/nonlinear-regression.html)
- [x] [ThetaForecaster](https://github.com/M4Competition/M4methods/blob/master/4Theta%20method.R) #198 
- [x] ExponentialSmoothing #198 
- [x] ARIMA #412 
- [x] AutoARIMA #104 
- [x] Automatic Exponential Smoothing, see [ETS](https://www.rdocumentation.org/packages/forecast/versions/8.12/topics/ets) in R, [source code](https://github.com/robjhyndman/forecast/blob/master/R/ets.R), see https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/350, statsmodels: https://www.statsmodels.org/dev/examples/notebooks/generated/ets.html
- [x] Croston's method #730 
- [x] Theta
- [x] Prophet
- [x] UnobserverdComponents #1394  
- [ ] Bayesian structural time series models (see #612), see also https://github.com/WillianFuks/tfcausalimpact

### Reduction
- [x] ReducedRegressionForecaster, see #218 
- [x] ReducedTimeSeriesRegressionForecaster, see #218 

### Composition
- [x] TransformedTargetForecaster (pipeline with target transformations, multiple steps)
- [x] EnsembleForecaster (see e.g. sklearn's [VotingRegressor](https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.ensemble.VotingRegressor.html#sklearn.ensemble.VotingRegressor))
- [x] StackingForecaster
- [x] ColumnEnsembler, multiple univariate forecasters on multivariate time series (forecasting trend and residuals separately, adding/multiplying results together) #1082 
- [x] FeatureUnion to get multiple transforms from a single time series (univariate to multivariate)
- [ ] Concatenator (or splicer) to get single series from segments of series in a pipelines with prior annotation and splicing according to annotations
- [ ] ensemble over steps in forecasting horizon ("direct strategy") which fits a separate model for each step ahead
- [x] other ensemble methods (weighted averages, etc) 
- [x] Recursive strategy (basically https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.multioutput.RegressorChain.html#sklearn.multioutput.RegressorChain)
- [x] Direct strategy (basically https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.multioutput.MultiOutputRegressor.html)
- [x] DirRec strategy #226 
- [x] support for models that inherently support multi-output (see e.g. https://machinelearningmastery.com/multi-output-regression-models-with-python/)

### Interfaces
- [x] statsmodels
- [x] pmdarima
- [x] fbprophet
- [ ] gluonts

### Multivariate/vector forecasting
- [x] TransformedTargetForecaster #1376 
- [x] NaiveForecaster #1401 
- [x] ForecastingPipeline #1376 
- [x] ForecastingGridSearchCV #1376 
- [x] RandomizedGridSearchCV #1376 
- [x] MultiplexForecaster #1376 
- [ ] make_reduction
- [ ] EnsembleForecaster
- [ ] AutoEnsembleForecaster
- [ ] StackingForecaster

## Transformers
- [x] Detrender (series to series, meta-estimator that works with any forecaster)
- [x] Deseasonaliser
- [x] FittedParamExtractor for regression/classification
- [x] BoxCoxTransformer (see [pmdarima's implementation](https://alkaline-ml.com/pmdarima/modules/generated/pmdarima.preprocessing.BoxCoxEndogTransformer.html))
- [x] Wrapper for sklearn's non-fittable transformers, so that we can apply them to single series (e.g. FunctionTransformer or scalers)
- [ ] TimeSeriesDecomposer (e.g. using LOESS seasonal-trend-residual decomposition) returning multivariate series 
- [x] OptionalPassthrough #762 
- [x] FeatureSelection #1347 
- [x] Imputer #1461 
- [x] SummaryTransformer #1329  
- [x] Differencer #945  
- [x] STL #1463 
- [x] DateTimeFeatures #1356
- [ ] Featurizer #1443 
- [x] MeanTransformer
- [x] SqrtTransformer #1127 
- [x] ThetaLines #923 
- [x] ExponentTransformer #1127 
- [ ] Smoothing transformer(s)
- [ ] Function transformer 

## Model selection
### Temporal CV
- [x] SlidingWindowSplitter
- [x] ManualWindowSplitter
- [x] SingleWindowSplitter
- [x] temporal_train_test_split
- [x] MultiplexForecaster #715 
- [x] ExpandingWindowSplitter

### Tuning
- [x] ForecastingGridSearchCV

## Pipelines
- [x] ForecastingPipeline (pipe on X)
- [ ] Advanced/unified Pipeline (see STEP https://github.com/sktime/enhancement-proposals/blob/main/steps/01_forecasting_api/forecasting_pipeline.md) 
- [ ] NetworkPipeline #856 

## Enhancements
- [x] in-sample predictions
- [x] prediction intervals (new interface)
- [ ] dynamic (using previously predicted values) vs static predictions
- [x] exogenous variables, including pipelines, multivariate transformers, etc
- [x] simplify `FH` class into separate utility functions
- [x] refactor `ForecastingGridSearchCV` and `update_predict()`, try to factor out separate cross-validation function

issue.title: Implement multi-output reduction strategy for ReducedRegressionForecaster

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
We currently support the following strategies for reduction from forecasting to regression (see this [file](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/master/sktime/forecasting/compose/_reduce.py)): 

- [x] direct
- [x] recursive
- [ ] dirrec (see #226)
- [ ] multi-output (see #440)

For an overview of forecasting strategies for multi-step forecasting horizons see this [paper](https://d1wqtxts1xzle7.cloudfront.net/41231210/Machine_Learning_Strategies_for_Time_Ser20160114-28513-1pqgoe9.pdf20160115-19908-phg1xc.pdf?1452888125=&response-content-disposition=inline%3B+filename%3DMachine_Learning_Strategies_for_Time_Ser.pdf&Expires=1602491710&Signature=V6cHqybz3g9idBMTkbC4kwDMppSA4FnO9cd~R0VY8JVmVUKrK28MGRJlKhMfODdsSxcWsT5wvu2y3elqoES3ILHn1vlka20fO9z~dYmKB4oPsV04fG3lRhDe1Sx5QKgSmU4PMpWxa3bAwE8DKC4dlDcuLY7wequBDkTlItBFeYqOrJUhc91tMJxMpJ7gVtDzmAFyP58Fw5iXQN19fhCe2RoMtQ2uLRJrWvmlEdRvOhrffgnOR1g9N71Nt01I3X5~DON8gmKEmaGKYWv1wYg7JrSmLXnyZ2gVBUgdhERUxZ7VKSOMp-z0KFsuPV1bL7MbIZrHs7eHMnXK9v4vqT47ig__&Key-Pair-Id=APKAJLOHF5GGSLRBV4ZA).  This issue is about the multi-output strategy. Some models can directly predict multiple outputs, see e.g. LinearRegression:
```python
import numpy as np
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression

y = np.random.normal(size=(10, 3))  # target has multiple columns
X = np.random.normal(size=(10, 5))

estimator = LinearRegression()
estimator.fit(X, y)
y_pred = estimator.predict(X)  # we predict multiple columns
print(y_pred.shape)
>>> (10, 3)
```
 
We need to enable the multi-output prediction strategy by adding a "multioutput" option to the "strategy" kwarg in the [`ReducedRegressionForecaster`](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/master/sktime/forecasting/compose/_reduce.py).

We could check the estimator by checking if it inherits from scikit-learn's `MultiOutputMixin`.

body: @mloning I'm looking into this. Is it alright?
Yes @luiszugasti implementing this would be great!

issue.title: Implement dirrec

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
#### Reference Issues/PRs
Working on issue #226. Assigned this project from sktime dev team. 
This code works upon the PR made by @Ayushmaanseth in #283.

#### What does this implement/fix? Explain your changes.
This is an additional strategy to reduce forecasting to time series regression. Specifically, DirRec strategy for reduction from forecasting to regression

#### Does your contribution introduce a new dependency? If yes, which one?
Not yet.

#### What should a reviewer concentrate their feedback on?
Incremental code improvements.

#### Any other comments?
None yet.

#### PR checklist
##### For all contributions
- [ ] I've added myself to the [list of contributors](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/main/.all-contributorsrc).
- [ ] Optionally, I've updated sktime's [CODEOWNERS](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/main/CODEOWNERS) to receive notifications about future changes to these files.
- [ ] I've added unit tests and made sure they pass locally.

##### For new estimator _strategies_
- [ ] I've added the estimator to the online documentation.
- [ ] I've updated the existing example notebooks or provided a new one to showcase how my estimator works.
